group_works.title: I am what I know
group_works.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films

results.title: I am what I know
results.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Encourages a positive attitude towards what we do know and towards attaining new knowledge. Children’s comments and songs are used to explain that different people know different things. Illustrates ways to feel better about one’s attainments. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: I'll quit tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Gerald T Rogers and GTR Productions
results.brief_description: Tells what happened to Steve Miller and his family as he develops the illness of alcoholism. Shows how it was arrested by a successful intervention by the family and employer.

results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 99, January 2002
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-099
